review: What Amazon doesn't tell you is that the Fire Stick must be within 10' of the router to work at all. Our router is on a different floor, and there's no way to achieve that distance. Too bad, but I wish that were part of the description -- we wouldn't have bothered, and now we have to send the darn this back.
author: Mary OFS

review: Well, had high hopes for this device.  Like many other reviewers, I've now gone through two of these and neither of them work.  The original was defective, so Amazon sent me a new one.  I was ecstatic that it seems to plug in and work with easy set up.  Unfortunately I had about a week of use before it began incessantly scanning, connecting, saving, disconnecting, scanning... you get the idea.  It saw my network, strong signal but it just simply could not stay connected.  I've rebooted it and spent far more time wasted on trying to fix it than it is clearly worth.  I would like to try the fire tv box in the hope that it works better, but now I'm pretty gun-shy about these devices in general.  I guess I'll go back to the roku.  Both are going back today.  A word to Amazon-  don't put products out that are sketchy on their reliability- every time you do that, you lose credibility with your customers.
